abstract: New York City Police Commissioner William J Bratton outlines initiatives aimed at giving police officers more time to talk with and address concerns of community members, and for acquisition of high-powered weapons for anti-terrorism unit; dual goals point to dissonance between desire to give force more human face and rising fear of violence by independent assailants.
lead_paragraph: In a speech on Thursday, Commissioner William J. Bratton presented plans for a Strategic Response Group, a specialized, heavily armed unit trained in antiterrorism.
snippet: In a speech on Thursday, Commissioner William J. Bratton presented plans for a Strategic Response Group, a specialized, heavily armed unit trained in antiterrorism.

headline.main: N.Y.P.D. Plans Initiatives to Fight Terrorism and Improve Community Relations
headline.print_headline: Bratton Envisions a Friendlier Force, and a New Unit to Respond to Big Events
